revised_title: Observations and Remarks on the Eruptions of Fire and Smoke from Mount Vesuvius
tldr: The author, Edw Berkeley, provides a detailed account of his observations and experiences during the eruptions of Mount Vesuvius. He describes the various phenomena, such as the smoke, flames, and molten stones, and offers insights into the behavior of the volcano. Berkeley also compares his observations with those of Borellus and discusses the inconsistencies in the latter's explanation of volcanic eruptions.
